feature1.explanation: Both texts use hyphens, colons, commas, and quotation marks in a similar manner, indicating a shared punctuation style.

feature2.explanation: Both texts exhibit a similar level of lexical variation and word choice, as well as consistent grammatical categories and part of speech usage.

feature3.explanation: The sentence structure and quantitative features in both texts show coherence and cohesion, with similar sentence complexity and length, indicative of a common writing style.

feature4.explanation: While the topics differ, both texts maintain a serious and informative tone with a focus on rules and consequences, suggesting a shared narrative style.

feature5.explanation: There were no spelling or typographical errors observed in either text, indicating a consistent level of attention to detail in writing.

overall.explanation: Based on the analysis of punctuation style, lexical and grammatical features, sentence structure and quantitative features, text and discourse features, as well as spelling and typographical errors, the likelihood that the two texts were written by the same author is high.
